subject: Politics
title: Neoliberalism
description: A micro-lesson that makes Neoliberalism usable.

hook.text: Thatcher and Reagan promised to shrink government and free markets. The result reshaped the global economy.

buildup.text: Neoliberalism favors privatization, deregulation, free trade, and reduced government spending.

discovery.text: Starting in the 1980s, neoliberal policies spread worldwide through the IMF, World Bank, and trade deals.

twist.text: Critics blame neoliberalism for inequality, financial crises, and hollowed-out public services.

climax.text: After 2008, faith in neoliberalism cracked. Even supporters admitted markets need some guardrails.

punchline.text: Neoliberalism freed markets. The debate is who paid the price.

quiz.question: What event shook faith in neoliberal economics?
options: The fall of the Berlin Wall
The founding of the United Nations
